concept.title: Product Help
concept.shortdesc: This content outlines the coordination between Engineering and TechPubs, regarding help development and access from the product interface. In the Digital Marketing Suite, product documentation is intended to be a formal part of the product. Access to information must be immediately available to users from Help menus, as well as context sensitively from selected dialog boxes and UI items.

conbody.p: Please follow these steps when collaborating to create access to product help:

ol.li: The writer generates help system file structure on the doc server.

The engineer provides access to the help system's landing page from the application's Help menu. (Help > Help Contents).
Example landing page: http://microsite.omniture.com/t2/help/en_US/dsc/index.html
In this example, dsc represents the product folder (Discover), and index.html is the common file name for help landing pages.

The writer and engineer collaborate on which features (dialogs, fields, and options) should include a context sensitive help icon, as shown here:
You can place similar help icons on fields and options. However, do not clutter the interface with help icons on every field and option. Add them only to potentially confusing options. You can standardize them on dialog boxes and windows.

The writer provides the URL to the engineer for the particular help icon.
Example: http://microsite.omniture.com/t2/help/en_US/dsc/index.html?f=c_metrics_calculations
Important: The URL must follow the f=filename format. (Do not add the .html file extension. This is so that localized help systems and products resolve to the correct destination.)
When a user clicks the Help icon, a pop-up should display the text from the first para tag in the HTML of the target URL. After the short description, add a Click here for more information link. For example:
When clicked, the link displays the whole topic from the target URL in the browser, as well as the help system's table of contents.
See for sample code.

entry.p: The home page for all product documentation. This location replaces the Knowledge Garden and provides access to all product docs, release notes, KB articles, implementation and developer docs. It also provides access to external resources like forums, blogs, EnterpriseTV, and AdobeTV.
In the Suite, located at Help > Help Home.
The name you use in your product's Help menu. (For example, Help > Help Contents.)
Help Contents opens a new tab that displays the product's help system landing page.
